title: St. Benilde School
text:
St. Benilde School, or simply known as Benilde, is a Private Catholic <a href="High%20school">High school</a> and <a href="Elementary%20school">Elementary school</a> in Lasalleville, <a href="Bacolod%20City">Bacolod City</a>, Philippines. It is one of the <a href="Lasallian%20educational%20institutions">Lasallian educational institutions</a> in the country. Benilde underwent through the supervision of <a href="University%20of%20St.%20La%20Salle">University of St. La Salle</a> and the <a href="De%20La%20Salle%20Brothers">De La Salle Brothers</a>, and is now a member of <a href="De%20La%20Salle%20Supervised%20Schools">Association of Lasallian Affiliated Schools (ALAS)</a>, a network of <a href="De%20La%20Salle%20Philippines">Lasallian</a> private schools. The school serves the community of students from neighboring subdivisions such as Lasalleville, St. Benilde Homes, Grandville, Hillside, Forest Hills, and Regent Pearl. It was founded as a La Salle School by <a href="Rolando%20Dizon">Br. Rolando Dizon FSC</a>, a past President of <a href="De%20La%20Salle%20University">De La Salle University</a>, Manila, in 1987.
History & Objectives.
<a href="Benildus%20Roman%C3%A7on">Saint Bénilde Romançon</a> was selected as the name and patron saint to symbolize its objective of providing the students the legacy of "Doing ordinary things, extra-ordinarily well". The school was founded on 1987 by the former <a href="De%20La%20Salle%20University">DLSU - Manila</a> President <a href="Br.%20Rolando%20Dizon%2C%20FSC">Br. Rolando Dizon, FSC</a>. The mission of St. Benilde commits to provide students a balanced, quality, and transformative education accessible to all, and geared towards the attachment of their full potential. Benilde envisions a world-class community of holistically developed 21st century learners that are globally equipped, competent, and responsible individuals. The school faculty and staff foster responsibility in nurturing atmosphere and provide a variety of spiritual, academic, and extracurricular opportunities for student involvement. In 2012, the school claimed its independence from the supervision of <a href="University%20of%20St.%20La%20Salle">University of St. La Salle</a> and has been a certified Lasallian school.
Campus.
Br. Dizon FSC Activity Center, the school gymnasium in the honor of the school founder, <a href="Br.%20Rolando%20Dizon%2C%20FSC">Br. Rolando Dizon, FSC</a>.
Elementary School, Intermediate School, and High School.
The elementary and intermediate are in the right wing of the building while junior high school is in the left wing. Because of the small population of the school, there is only one sector per year level in elementary, intermediate, and high school; each sector was named after the De La Salle Saints, Martyrs, and Blesseds.
Years and Sectors:
Benilde Student Life.
Benilde offers organizations, as well as athletics. The athletics program includes varsity <a href="association%20football">football</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a>, <a href="table%20tennis">table tennis</a>, and <a href="chess">chess</a>. School organizations includes the Student Affairs Council (SAC), Campus Peer Ministry (CPM), CPM Choir, and St. Benilde CHIMES: The official school publication of St. Benilde. The school also offer Junior Police Unit (JPU), the disciplinary program for year 8 to year 10 in secondary school.
